title: Project Planning and Requirements Gathering
description: Define the project scope, objectives, and requirements. Identify target users, use cases, and desired features.

title: System Architecture Design
description: Design the overall system architecture, including the frontend, backend, and data storage components. The architecture should be modular, scalable, and maintainable, with clear separation of concerns. Consider the following components: 1) Frontend: A user-friendly interface for presenting code snippets, accepting user input for documentation, and providing feedback. The frontend should be responsive and accessible, with a clean and intuitive UI/UX design. 2) Backend: Handle user authentication, code snippet management, documentation evaluation, and feedback generation. The backend should be built using a modern, scalable framework or language, with a RESTful API for communication with the frontend. 3) Data Storage: Store code snippets, user submissions, and other relevant data. Consider using a reliable and scalable database solution, such as a relational database or a NoSQL database, depending on the data structure and requirements. 4) Integration with external tools or services (if required), such as code linting tools, documentation generators, or plagiarism checkers. 5) Security considerations for user data and system access, including authentication, authorization, data encryption, and secure communication protocols. 6) Deployment and infrastructure requirements, including containerization, load balancing, and scalability considerations. 7) Logging and monitoring mechanisms for tracking system performance and troubleshooting issues.

title: User Interface Design
description: Design the user interface for the application, including wireframes and mockups.

title: Code Snippet Management
description: Implement a system for managing and storing code snippets to be used in the documentation challenges.

title: Documentation Evaluation and Feedback
description: Develop a mechanism to evaluate user-submitted documentation and provide feedback on its quality and completeness.

title: User Authentication and Authorization
description: Implement user authentication and authorization mechanisms to manage user accounts and access controls.

title: Documentation Guidelines and Best Practices
description: Develop a set of guidelines and best practices for writing clear and comprehensive code documentation.

title: Continuous Integration and Deployment
description: Set up a continuous integration and deployment pipeline for automated testing, building, and deploying the application.

title: Database Design and Implementation
description: Design and implement the database schema for storing user data, code snippets, documentation submissions, and related metadata. The schema should support efficient querying and retrieval of data for the application's functionality. Consider using a document-oriented database like MongoDB or a relational database like PostgreSQL, depending on the data structure and querying requirements. Ensure proper indexing, data integrity constraints, and scalability considerations.
